page.title: 05HISTORY OF HOLT-continued
page.content: THROUGH FARNDON AND HOLT INTO WALES. IN 1086{THE DOMESDAY SURVEY} TOOK PLACE AND ALTHOUGH NO MENTION OF HOLT WAS MADE THE NEIGHBOURING {FERANDUN-FARNDON }IS MENTIONED AS HAVING 2 PRIESTS WHO HELD 1.5 HIDES OF LAND HERE AND OXEN TO PLOUGH.HOLT SEEMS TO HAVE DEVELOPED IN A LARGE WOODED AREA AND WAS INCLUDED IN THE MANOR OF{ALENTUNE-ALLINGTON }WHICH IS MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY SURVEY. IN 1349 A.D{THE BLACK DEATH} HAD REACHED THIS PART OF THE COUNTRY. ARRIVING SUDDENLY IN JUNE AND STAYING UNTIL SEPTEMBER.HOLT POPULATION DROPPED FROM 650 PEOPLE IN 1315 TO ONLY 300 IN 1391.THERE WAS GREAT TRADE BETWEEN HOLT AND CHESTER AT THIS TIME,BOATS GOING CONTINUALLY FROM HOLT.BUT THE BLACK DEATH TOOK THE LIVES OF ALOT OF THE BOATMEN AND THE WATER-BORNE TRADE NEVER RECOVERED.
